Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw different types of land and water habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream, with clear differentiation between them.
The student can illustrate various living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams, with appropriate placement.
The student can effectively compare and show the different types of plants and animals seen in different habitats, depicting diversity accurately.
The student can display clear patterns in plant and animal diversity across the different habitats they draw, showing understanding of ecosystems.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit labeling a living thing or habitat element, though this is minor and does not detract from overall understanding.
In rare cases, the student might mix up specific animal types with their respective habitats (e.g., placing a fish in a forest) but quickly reconciles it or acknowledges the mistake.
